intro: Tarenna confusa, commonly known as the Java tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tarenna confusa is often found in tropical rainforests, growing as an understory shrub. It has limited commercial use but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
